sentence.Network_en: After a year we will sympathetically consider an application for reinstatement.
sentence.Network_cn: 一年后我们会对复职申请予以考虑和批准。

sentence.Network_en: He welcomed the reinstatement of the 10 per cent bank base rate.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对恢复10%的银行基准利率表示欢迎。

sentence.Network_en: Parents campaigned in vain for her reinstatement.
sentence.Network_cn: 父母们呼吁给她复职，但结果却只是徒劳。

entry.def: Reinstatement is the act of giving someone back a job or position which has been taken away from them.

example.ex: Parents campaigned in vain for her reinstatement.
example.tran: 父母们呼吁给她复职，但结果却只是徒劳。

entry.tran: (法律、做法等的)恢复;（设施等的）修复
entry.def: The reinstatement of a law, facility, or practice is the act of causing it to exist again.

example.ex: He welcomed the reinstatement of the 10 per cent bank base rate.
example.tran: 他对恢复10%的银行基准利率表示欢迎。

sentences.sentence: "her reinstatement to her former office followed quickly"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of restoring someone to a previous position;

sentences.sentence: "we insisted on the reinstatement of the colonel"
